snippet: An administrative law judge with the California Public Utilities Commission has recommended that a "Caller ID" telephone service proposed by Pacific Bell, GTE-California and Contel not be approved. Pacific Bell said it would challenge the recommen...
lead_paragraph: An administrative law judge with the California Public Utilities Commission has recommended that a "Caller ID" telephone service proposed by Pacific Bell, GTE-California and Contel not be approved. Pacific Bell said it would challenge the recommendation. The proposed service would display the number of the caller on a small box attached to the telephone. The companies would allow customers to prevent their numbers from appearing on a recipient's Caller ID box in a process called "blocking."
